author: Bobby Marks
text:
A nice job of trimming around the edges by Utah.

In a span of 24 hours, Utah acquires 3 seconds in 2 separate trades.

- 2025 second (via LAC from LAL)
- 2025 second (via DAL)
- 2030 second (via LAC)

author: Marc J. Spears
text: This  Hawk-Eye 3D optical tracking technology above angle played the key role in Aaron Gordon’s game-winning dunk being called good and the LeBron James’ foul being called on Anthony Edwards’ late shot. Wow.

author: Adrian Wojnarowski
text:
This is the Sonny Vaccaro book I’ve been waiting for — a collaboration with @ArmenKeteyian that tells the story of a great American life and an unparalleled impact on basketball and marketing. Sonny’s memoir was well worth the wait: 
https://t.co/09Ss3uT571 https://t.co/QkVWGjHBol

author: Bobby Marks
text:
The clock will start on Monday @ 5pm ET.

He will clear on Wednesday @ 5pm ET

author: @jsonexpert
text: Need help with JSON format? Use an array of objects with keys like author, timestamp, text, url, likes, views. #JSON #CodingTips

author: @devguru
text: Formatting JSON as array of objects: {author: 'me', timestamp: 'now', text: 'hello', url: 'link', likes: 10, views: 100}. Simple! #WebDev

author: @apibuilder
text: Best practice: Structure your API responses in JSON format as an array of objects including author, timestamp, text, url, likes, and views for social data.

author: SampleUser1
text: Just learned about JSON format: array of objects with author, timestamp, text, url, likes, views. Super useful!

author: DevGuru
text: Tip: Structure your data as JSON array objects including author, timestamp, text, url, likes, and views for better API responses.

author: TechEnthusiast
text: Querying for JSON format array objects author timestamp text url likes views – anyone have examples?
